Metadata.Title: The Server Implements the Latest SSL Version
Metadata.DirectLink: The Server Implements the Latest SSL Version
Metadata.Author: Serge Batchilo, Jason Taylor, Joe Basirico

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 4.1
  • PCI DSS Requirement 4.1.c

What to Check For

If a web application uses SSL, the server should support the latest patched version.

Why

SSL v2 has known vulnerabilities in it, making SSL v2 unacceptable. The latest SSL version has addressed these vulnerabilities. New vulnerabilities may be found in the future, requiring a newer version of SSL to be used.

How to Check

Access a web page on the server over SSL using Internet Explorer 8. Make sure the address bar turns green. Click on the padlock on the right side of the address bar. Click "View Certificates." Select the "Details" tab. If the Version field has value "V3," then the server is using SSL v3, which is currently the latest version.

How to Fix

Most recent web servers support the latest SSL version. If your server does not support the latest SSL version, consider updating it or installing a newer web server.
